title: new​
content: </> PartySync.new(Config: { Name: string, Type: string, MaxSize: number?, BatchOverrides: { Size: number?, Delay: number? }?, }) → PartySync Creates a new PartySync object. Name (string): The name of the PartySync, Type (string): The type of the PartySync, Options are "Persistent" and "Temporary". MaxSize (number): The maximum size of the Party. Defaults to 5. BatchOverrides (table, optional): The batch overrides for the Processor. Size (number, optional): The number of requests to process at once. Defaults to 20 Delay (number, optional): The delay between each batch. Defaults to 30

title: Get​
content: </> PartySync:Get(Player: Player ) → Party Creates a new Party object for the Player, if they are not already in a Party, other-wise returns the existing Party object.

title: new​
content: </> Processor.new( Callback: (Event: Types.Process) → boolean, Config: { Size: number?, Delay: number? }? ) → Processor Creates a new Processor object. Callback ((Event: Types.Process) -> boolean): The callback function to process the events. Config (table, optional): The configuration for the Processor. Size (number, optional): The number of requests to process at once. Defaults to 20 Delay (number, optional): The delay between each batch. Defaults to 30 The Processor object processes events in a queue, in a batch like manor, with a delay between each batch. The Processor object will attempt to process all events in the queue, in the event of a server shutdown.

title: Updated​
content: </> Party.Updated: Signal Signal that fires when the party is being Updated.

title: PlayerAdded​
content: </> Party.PlayerAdded: Signal Signal that fires when a player is added to the party.

title: PlayerRemoved​
content: </> Party.PlayerRemoved: Signal Signal that fires when a player is removed from the party.

title: Destroying​
content: </> Party.Destroying: Signal Signal that fires when the party is being destroyed.

title: Add​
content: </> Party.Add(Player: Player ) → Promise Adds a player to the party. Player (Player): The player to add to the party. Returns a Promise.

title: Remove​
content: </> Party.Remove(Player: Player ) → Promise Removes a player from the party. Player (Player): The player to remove from the party. Returns a Promise.

title: SetMaxSize​
content: </> Party.SetMaxSize(MaxSize: number) → Promise Sets the maximum size of the party. MaxSize (number): The new maximum size of the party. Returns a Promise.

title: Destroy​
content: </> Party.Destroy() → () Destroys the party. should internally be called when the party is empty.
